Dr. Williams is a great prof. She loves to teach, and she's fun. Going to her class is nice because it can be relaxing and insightful. You will work hard, but she is a nice person. People complain too much when they don't get A's in HSS classes.

The class is not one that's easy to sleep through, not just because you'd fail for sure, but because it's sure to keep your attention. She expects you to do your work, but she is always VERY helpful. She's a very fun and exciting person.

Williams is the most enjoyable prof at Rose. What a breath of fresh air from the mainly geeky professors of theory. She is very funny and entertaining every day. She grades somewhat hard, but she is fair. Workload isn't bad, not a blowoff class, but not very stressful either.
Psycho woman. Her interest this quarter has been mostly to rally everyone against the institute president.
Dr. Williams requires a lot, but is very willing to accomodate you with flexible deadlines and such. There was a lot of work, but usually it wasn't too bad.
Hard grader, but class was enjoyable. It was my first class of the day, but I never fell asleep.
Is this prof. writing her own evaluations? I wouldnt put it past her. Believe me, her class is not that easy. Its not all fun and games.
She was comical, sarcastic, great prof for this class. Don't know how she is for like, Tech Comm, but for the type of class that Creative writing is, she was a great prof.

She's hilarious. The class has been nothing but laughs and good times. She's very good and very helpful. Even if you're taking a class for a blow off you'll leave having had a good time and a new interest in the subject. Probably the most amusing class I've ever had at Rose. She's awesome.
Enjoyable class. Keeps you awake.
She's awesome. Class is always interesting and fun to go to. She is so sarcastic it's hilarious.

She is AMAZING!! She is so awesome. She makes me WANT to go to class...how awesome is that? She grades pretty easy too. Basically, we decided how to take our tests this year! IT ROCKED! So, overall: SHE'S EXCELLENT!
Great teacher, very nice and forgiving. i slept through one of her quizzes in a 12 O clock and she let me make it up no penalty. I recommend her.
She is a good prof who is involved and cares whether or not you understand the material. I recommend her.
This class was so much fun. Anyone who dislikes Dr. Williams is crazy. Her style was exciting and she kept me interested.

has pets in the class at times she and the pets are the only people interested in the discussion

sooo hard

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade:

Intro to Film is a very easy class. All we do is watch 10 movies. They are actually decent movies too like The Godfather and Traffic. We write 1 paper and there are 2 essay test. She gives a hand out with 20 questions over the material covered and 4 of those questions are on the test.
This is a good teacher who knows her subject. She is helpful, clear, and above all cute.
This is a no-sweat course for an easy A. I highly recommend it when you have a quarter with a heavy load. Her mind seemed to be somewhere else but I gave her a HOT rating.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
This class is super easy. You really don't have to do any reading that's assigned because Dr. Dyer doesn't call on anyone and force them to talk in class. The essays aren't that bad either.

Her class is very easy, but there is a fair amount of work. You have to read an essay every night to discuss the next day in class. There are 4 papers, which you can write about whatever you want, as long as it is the required type, but she grades pretty hard on those. A B+ is very easy to get.

Extremely easy class. Every day there is a fairly short reading assigned. All you do in class is discuss the reading. Four papers to write the entire quarter, longest of which was 6-8 pages. Not to hard at all. However, getting an A is rediculously hard, but a B is easy to come by.

Easy teacher. She doesn't give many A's, usually for the best paper. Assigns HW, but it is really easy. Readings are also assigned, but are never used. I went to her on my last paper, and had her edit it and got a B+, i recommend doing that
The amount of work was just right.
too easy -- I had a better class in high school. Why do we have to take this course when nothing is taught. we only wrote 3 papers
Extremely easy teacher. She occasionally assigned readings from the book, but I never did, and it didn't matter that I didn't. I couldn't imagine this class being any easier.
she is the best teacher for rh 131. Best part is she is cool in class, not much homework, although she is rather strict in grading. The class doesn't become such a burden.
She knows very little about film, has no degree or formal training, and teaches entirely out of the book. Tests are essay based and hard unless you memorize the book, but there's no homework per se.
No Comments
Just have good grammar when writing papers, she grades grammar and punctuation, not personal ideas. No homework, just 3 papers every 2-3 weeks, then an oral presentation.

very nice. class was fun. no homework.

Attendance: Mandatory
Textbook: No
I took this class to learn about sustainable technologies -- not to be preached at. Very rude to students in class. Reading is boring. Writing assignments if you don't take the position he likes, you get below a C. Content is really slanted and not very useful.

Textbook: No
He is good at talking but nothing else. Hard grader.

Textbook: Yes
Minster's class structure is awful. You will learn more from his day to day reading assignments than you will learn from him.

Textbook: Yes
Dr. Minster is a great teacher who jokes around daily. He is similar to other english professors in that he is somewhat particular in what he expects everyone's writing style to be like. However, he is very understanding and accepting of other's opinions, despite what some may say. He is not super easy, but not super hard either.

Textbook: No
Minster is awesome. He seems strange at first, but eventually you'll realize that he's just a hilarious person. His papers are tough, but he teaches very well, so you'll become a better writer. I found classes to be extremely fun, even though I wasn't too interested in the subject. Basically, Minster's the man.

Textbook: No
I have to say, he's a pretty cool guy. He grades the four writing assignments with an extremely high standard, but he makes the class so that if writing is not your strongest point, you can still do decently (like me). Awesome lectures. I recommend this prof.

Textbook: No
His class is awesome, very fun and entertaining, yet the readings are superabundant, and he grades the essays with very high standard. The average is usually a C on the essays and merely 1 or 2 A's.

Textbook: No
Minster is halarious, but you never know what to expect when you get to class... his text choices also were pretty bad for this quarter, but he said he is going to change them. He loves to laugh and make you laugh and if you get involved with the class, you will do much better. Have I mentioned that he makes me laugh yet?

Textbook: Yes
He was a lot of fun and kept the lectures light. His papers and tests were not hard and if you showed up to class you were rewarded with a decent grade.

Textbook: Yes
He's the bomb-diggity. Half the people I know who have had him before are now pursuing literature minors just to have him in class more often. He's the coolest hippie-prof ever. Listen to everything he says. He knows what he's talking about, and if you're paying attention, you will too.

Normally doesn't teach tech comm, but if given the option, I think he's a pretty good option to take the course with. Really cool about doing work in the class and helpful... Pretty easy to pass the course, but may be hard to get an A...

Dr. Minster is a kick-ass prof. He doesn't know anything about engineering or math, but its kinda refreshing to have someone who hasn't focused their life on that stuff. He gave a decent amount of HW, but most of it was at least semi-interesting. He's just a cool guy, take him if you get the chance.
Likes to cover a lot of a material, but made class very interesting and fun! He is hilarious, and a fair grader. He is also awesome to just talk to, I urge you to go visit him during office hours!
Presents material clearly. Tests are fair. Very interesting person.
Seems to really like what he teaches.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Tough grader but always willing to help. If you really put effort into your papers, you'll do well. He's one of the funniest profs I've had, and I learned alot in his class.

quizzes almost every day. doesn't understand that this is an UNDERGRADUATE ENGINEERING college, not a graduate english major college. grades extreamly hard. also doesn't understand that "opinion" questions don't have wrong answers. avoid him like the plague.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Although he grades hard on some items, he loves to help you and is VERY leniant on his grading. He will accept many answers as long as you defend them and he will extend due-dates based on the decisions of the whole class. He is an AMAZING teacher and do whatever it takes to get him as a prof!

If you have any beef w/this man, then the problems are on your end. Dr. Minster is smart, witty, and unique. He incorporates his personality into his teaching style better than any prof. I've ever had. Take a class from guy. It should be on life's "to do list."
i loved Dr. minster. His jokes were hilarious. And he came up with the best metaphor ever about relating school to a 50 year old **** with burn scars over all of her body.

I have no idea what the other ratings are talking about. I thought his class was slow and dull. He tries to be funny and entertaining. If you ask me I think he filled out some of those ratings. What engineer writes like that? I think the style of writing is more typical of a creative writing major.

He lets his personal opinions and interpretations interfere with grading. He loses sight that we are engineers and not english majors. In class he goes off on akward tangents. It is like he is in his own strange world.

I don't know about RH131, but he's certainly made the Bible interesting. This man is hilarious. His sense of humor reminds me of a low-key Conan O'Brien. Not too much work. A little reading every night and a paper a week. I haven't noticed any steep grading. B+ isn't hard to get. I highly recommend.

Dr. Minster is the only teacher I've ever had that made an english class enjoyable. He is an amazingly funny, smart, and witty guy. I strongly encourage taking a Minster class because for 50 minutes a day, 4 days a week, you'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll learn and you'll have fun doing it.

Brilliant guy. One of the best instructors I've ever had. Funny as hell. Tough grader but oh so worth every purple mark on your papers. If you take his class (and you should!), ask him about Gary Snyder and William Blake sometime...

He runs one of the hardest classes you can imagine. His grading is realllly steep. Good Work = C grade. Not to mention TONS of homework. Not much really gets done in class, however he is a fun and a nice guy and this class was much harder than all the other English classes.

Mister is a cool guy, but he is a tough grader. If you're not willing to go the extra mile, he is definitely not for you. But if you want to have a good time and learn something, I say go for it. He'll even hang out and chat during office hours.
Stud. Hilarious as hell, good guy - his homework assignments are funnier than just about anything, too.
Funny guy. HW assignments and grading of rough drafts were pretty helpful. Tough on grading, but lenient on due dates. If a few people asked for an extension on a paper, he'd give it to us.
Dr. Minster is a pretty helpful guy, that is easy to get along with. He does grade a litle steep, but he always tells you how to make your work better.
He is a very funny man. Besides that his class is pretty difficult. He told us that he believes an A is almost not possible, because an A would be perfection.

If you are not an english major or once thought about being one, you will find this class extremely hard. He is slightly helpful, but his grading is still really bad. He also contradicts himself making it hard to decipher what he is talking about.

He was very funny and extremely helpful. He was tough grading the papers but had lots of stuff to help you boost it up. Besides the papers everything else seemed to be a finish it with some effort and you wil do well. I definitely recommend him.

He is a great guy and loves what he does...knows his stuff too. His class was very hard and a lot of work, but fun and there were very good discussions. He will work with you on deadlines and help get you started on papers if you are having trouble.

complete liar, and ****. wont help at all. Way to much reading think that his class is your main focus. Wont take him unless you want a hard time and be very bored

Classes go very quickly. He is very clear in his spanish, although he uses the vosotros form and that takes a little getting used to. Class itself is pretty easy, most stuff is completion based. The tests are a little hard.

The class periods generally just seem like a waste. Homework is rarely collected, and rarely mentioned in class. Most of the grade come from quizzes at the end of each period which can be graded way to harshly. Cool guy though, just not the best teaching style for me.

Decent Prof. He speaks in Spanish about 98% of the time, which really makes you pay attention and learn at the same time. The only thing is he is a pretty picky grader. Got a B- on our puppet show since our puppet's mouth wasn't constantly moving. Otherwise, not bad at all.

Awesome professor. He knows you don't come to Rose to take Spanish so he is leniant, while still doing a good job of teaching which is exactly what you want in a spanish professor. I feel like I learned well even though the class wasn't very hard.
Cool guy, doesn't expect you to speak good spanish at all, but expects you to try. I learned a lot, and had fun. Takes some effort to get an A though.

He knows you are not here to take Spanish so is leniant. He will not hound you if you didn't do your homework and is flexible. He is good to take and you learn something out of it. Only 10 minutes of homework a night + 3 one page papers and a speech.

Good prof, but he's kind of boring. Very nice guy though. I got the same grade as a friend who had a test average 20% less and the same grades on homework/quizzes/projects so I'm not sure about his grading. His dialect is from Spain, kind of confusing.
Very boring.
Fun teacher, went fast sometimes. you really have to pay attention but he isn't too bad.
Fun person, loves to chat in Spanish about anything the student wants to chat about.
Very enjoyable class. Lots of good discussion. Not afraid to let the students do the talking. Only weakness is toughness of grading.
Dr. Gardner is awesome! He's nice, funny, and a really good teacher.
Too much hw
Goofy looking Conan Obrian replica with a spitting spanish accent

Textbook: No
The worst professor I've had in my two years at Rose. He can't explain concepts to save his life, he rambles on and on, and he was very poor at addressing questions students had in class. Avoid at ALL COSTS.

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes
He really gets into his lectures.

I had him for Disco II. He probably makes 4 to 5 mistakes daily on the board, and students have to point them out. He is very unsure of himself, and he doesn't actually teach. If you read the book, you'll learn much more than if you listen to him. I got the lowest grade on his tests that I've ever gotten in my entire life. Avoid him if you can.

Worthless. I learned almost nothing while in his class. He wastes time by showing off what he has done in Maple, but when something goes wrong with his script, he falls apart. His tests are increadibly easy. If you are a good self learner, he might be a good option. Otherwise, avoid. NOT recomended.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Dr. Broughton would be a great teacher if you already knew all the material he was teaching you and the purpose of the class was to unlearn it. I come in to class some days and wonder if he kept teaching after we left the previous day.
He is a terrible prof. His tests are hard and you don't learn much. The worst part is he is very comfortable with failing people. I would not suggest taking his class.

This guy really pulled a 180. Last year i had him and i thought he was a jerk off. This year, he seems to have found a sence of humor, and i actually dont mind going to class. Despite all the past ratings, hes a good prof to take.

Difficult mainly because he is the dept. chair. Dr. Broughton is incredibly smart, and he is willing to correct mistakes he has made in stupid places like boardwork. Study up for tests, and make sure you're just not pressed for time: long tests!

Terrible. He makes a ton of mistakes during class and makes simple things complicated. Except to apply tangent and normal lines to every concept learned. Grading policy sucks--homework is graded on correctness with all even problems, and tests don't relate to the material.
Terrible. Didnt know what he was doing half the time
he taught us stuff that we didnt even really need to know. He said it was for our own knowledge. What kind of prof talks about stuff we dont even need to know. He sucks.
This guy is horrible. It is almost impossible to get full credit on an assignment. His lectures are very unclear and make even the easiest of concepts seem impossible.
This guy is awful-his grading is terrible and he makes you feel like you know nothing-AVOID!
Holy heck...he is the worst teacher I've had...ever. If I had known what his class was like I would have dropped it like a hot potato.
he is the worst teacher out there. do every thing to prevent taking his class.

His grading is the worst I've ever heard of. First he grades on the right answer, if you dont have the right answer, you get no credit. Next he grades your methods, if you dont use his methods and his notation for everything you get no credit.
He is the worst teacher i have ever had in my entire life, and i have had a lot of teachers.

Textbook: Yes
Good Professor! He is very informative and will try to explain how to do things in the easiest fashion. Doesn't like the book too much. He is very smart, but doesn't explain things as much as needed occasionally. I was decently prepared for the final. He doesn't assign too much homework. Overall, one of the better math teachers!

fun guy, though sometimes operates under the false impression that people get what he's talking about...

his tests are impossible and his quizes are hard but he usually has retakes for them. easiest home work grade ill ever have, really smart and will go over things many times if you show you dont understand but mostly imposibly hard grader. good teacher.

Okay, I have to admit he does give help to students. However, he usually assumes everyone has taken a whole year of calculus before coming to Rose. As a result, the pace he teaches is SUPER FAST!!! Quizzes & Tests are impossible to finish within the time limit he gives too.
Great teacher, couldnt ask for much more from him.
Lautzenheiser tells students just enough to point them in the right direction, then will answer questions if they get stuck. He makes it intersting and keeps students awake.
Lautzy is money, he's tons of help and you can tell he really loves what he's teaching about. He is always so excited that he kept me awake and interested in his lectures
He seems to absolutly love the subject and keeps it interesting with his quirky sense of humor. I wish I could have him for all my math classes
Good prof, extremely excited over math. You'll do well if you pay attention to his lectures... but they get on your nerves a bit.

He really explained Calc 3 very well, and by the exams I understood each topic perfectly with no outside effort. His teaching of vectors was amazing, although he tended to get a bit too excited over them...

I wish I had him for all of my math classes!! He is terrific!! He is clear, enthusiastic and very helpful. His tests, quizzes, and assignments are not too difficult if you pay attention. He prepares you very well for everything!!

Even though he says some odd stuff, he does genuinely care about his students and I enjoy stopping in his office occasionally. I would recommend both FTC and him.

For Credit: Yes

This man really cares about his students and has done so for a long time. Would definitely recommend him for Fast Track Calculus and any other math class.

For Credit: Yes

very bad for DE2 doesn't quite know how to tell you the material that will be on exams.

For Credit: Yes

Great guy and an amazing teacher. One of the best math teachers ive had. Explains things multiple different ways to make sure you understand. Take this man's class if you are able to, you WILL NOT REGRET IT.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
He's a nice guy. Homework is very long at first but it gets much more reasonable. Always there before first period if you have questions. Friendly, although sometimes acts frustrated (it's really just excitement!). No partial credit on quizzes and most tests so be very careful with your work. Lets you redo any HW, which is great.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Dr. Graves was an awesome professor. I had him for calculus 2 and loved it. He is always there to help and his lectures were always related to test material. Go to his review sessions before each test because he will go over everything that will be on the test. If you do your homework and actually try in this course, you will get an easy A.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Passionate about the students and the subject. He works hard to ensure students understand the topic, so most students leave with a good grade as well as an understanding of the subject. However, he works at his own pace; there was a bit of material on the final that we did not cover in class.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: No
Sometimes he seems kinda crazy and goes off on strange tangents. Very good professor though, makes things clear. Grades tests very strictly, but he is usually clear before hand for what small things he will take big points off for.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Professor Graves is straight forward and teaches material in a way that can be easily understood. Lets students know what topics will be covered on tests and is extremely accommodating if you have any conflicts need extra time. Took him for MA 102 and MA 113. Number one in the math department by far!

Textbook: Yes
He is an amazing professor, by far the best teacher I've ever had. Had him for fast track and DE1.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is pretty much my hero. I had him for Fast Track and for DE1. He always explained well in class, and while his assignments (for DE1) were daily, they would be only about an hour of work. His tests were easy if you did the homework. The only thing: be prepared to spend an hour talking to him if you go to his office hours.

Textbook: Yes
He is a good professor, he does mistakes as any human bean. However, that is OK and fixable. For me it was a little bit difficult to flow his writing on the board. He hands notes but I never used them, I preferred taking my own notes. If you have any difficulty he would be very helpful. I really recommend him.

Textbook: No
makes too many horrible mistakes, avoid him if you cares about your future math ability, otherwise go for him for your GPA

Textbook: Yes
Absolutely fantastic. Told funny stories that either pertained to the material or were completely random, but always fun overall. If something wasn't clear he would keep explaining until we got it. Definitely cares about his students. The tests weren't too bad and the nightly hw was a good way to learn the material well.

Textbook: Yes
He is good in every way. Graves makes class fun and tests are easy. He teaches class very well.

Textbook: No
"Silly rabbit, you're not a snake" he taught me for fast track calculus, and he was so spirited about it that we coulsn't help but get wxcited with hm

Textbook: Yes
He's the best math teacher I've ever had. Hilarious. I love his class.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is awesome. He is hilarious in class and he teaches really well. he makes sure that EVERYONE understands whatever he is saying, so sometimes you move slowly, but it's not a problem. take him if you can the homework load isn't too bad (short assignments each night) and the tests are straight forward.

Textbook: No
One of the easier math professors at Rose. I don't think his lectures are very good, but you cant help but like the guy anyways. I'm not a major so when I needed to take match courses I tried to get them with him just to get some easy A or B.

Textbook: Yes
He's an OK teacher but not as good as some of the other comments would indicate. He makes lots of mistakes. He's alot like a high school teacher he assigns homework daily and doesn't even have a PhD! OK, but there are better options.

Textbook: Yes
Awesome prof. Very easy to understand, always willing to re-explain or help. Lots of homework, due every day, but definitely helped understand the material. He used MAPLE a lot, which I liked. 10th week he spent going over old finals problems, I was definitely prepared for the final, aced it. His tests aren't too bad, some 'challenge' problems.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is money if you don't know the material well. Hefty homework load 4 assignments a week w/2-10 problems which are worth as much as the final. Clear explanations, though it does get a little absurd when he asks "Any questions?" about stuff you should have learned already, like simple algebra

Textbook: Yes
One of the best math teachers.

Textbook: Yes
Explained everything clearly. Maple was used every class.

Textbook: Yes
Amazing prof. Graves is a really nice professor and always willing to help. Difficult to understand sometimes, but if you ask him again he'll clairfy everything. Gives a fair amount of homework, but it helps a lot for the tests and helps you to understand it. I also had him for FTC.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is an awesome guy. He really provides alot of clarity and will always be glad to go back and explain things. He presents things in different ways from the books, but he does give a lot of book work. However you learn the material and you can decide if you even want the homework to count toward your grade at the end of the quarter.
I heard stuff sayin Graves was the man. I strongly disagree. He gives out like 10 problems a night and they're TOUGH. Dont take him and just like the math department here, it sucks

Lectures are really good and interesting. Gives a ton of homework, but you definitely learn the material. He also lets you redo the homework for full credit, but he doesn't accept any late work at all. Probably one of the better math profs at Rose.
He gives reasonable tests, is in his office always willing to help, and keeps the class entertained constantly even when it's 8 in the morning and you want to die.
Tons of homework, but that's how you learn. Right now... we're talking about 2 hours a night - but he's a really good teacher, and I really feel like I know the material.
Prof Graves was cool. Always was very explicit on what was going to be on tests and quizes. Sometimes he would give us some of the questions before a test. But homework is due every day.

Dr. Graves is Soooo funny! I had calc at 9:00 and he definitely kept us awake....tried to explain u-substitution integrals by relating them to snakes and bunnies...Lets you redo homework for full credit. He takes a geniune interest in your success...

Great teacher. Teaches the material well. Gives a ton of hw, but if you keep up with it, you will do well on tests and final. Little goofy, but he keeps you entertained. Try to get him if you can...one of the best math profs Rose has.

Hyper as anyone I've ever seen, but that just means she's enthusiastic about this subject. Her tests are easy, her homework is cake, and she is as helpful as they come. You have to be a total slapdick not to do well in this class. Just remember to study for your tests, or you could get screwed.
She's a great teacher. You'll learn the material and get a good grade at the same time.

Great guy, I'm sittin in his class right now. Tests are easy if you do the review. Homework is due every Thursday and is more than doable...Projects aren't demanding either. Highly recommended prof.

He is very helpful and lienent if you don't have time to get your homework done. His tests are easy, but you are pushed for time. I am not sure how prepared I am going to be for the final.

He seems so unorganized. Don't plan on getting any homework back, ever. Also, he is very judgemental. I won't take his class again.

Last 10 mins are reserved for a worksheet with 2 problems you have to do before leaving class.

Grade:

Textbook: No

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: No
This class is amazing. You will learn a lot and not deal with the normal annoyances of school. You will actually learn and you'll do fine if you do your work.

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: No

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: No

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes
Dr. Rickert is a genius. He moves fast, ask questions as he goes or go to his office for help. He gives a decent size homework assignment every night. The next day he answers questions & you turn it in the day after, if he decides to take it up. The only thing I didn't like were his tests. They were ridiculous! But luckily he did curves.

Textbook: Yes
Dr. Rickert's awesome. He really knows his stuff (he can race Maple and win for crying out loud...). He is able to lead you through derivations as well as teach you new material well, usually having students work through problems instead of simply showing how. Tests are difficult, but he uses a nice curve. Two thumbs up!

Textbook: Yes
Good teacher. Explains things very thouroughly. Tests can be hard, but the curves are rediculously great. Once got a 66% and it curved to a B

He goes really fast in class and assigns practice problems ever night. However, he rarely collects homework and always goes over the homework from the night before. If you are not quick at picking up math probably don't take this course with him.

Dr. Rickert is a genius. I was blown away sometimes by his pure talent and intellect. He was always patient with us and willing to explain things to us, no matter how long it took (he put off the next day's homework more than once because we didn't understand the material entirely yet). His tests were hard, but other than that I loved the class.

He does not give any lectures. He gives you homework, expects you to understand it, and if you dont he will go over the homework. You basically have to already understand most of the material to do well. Not horrible but not great either.

He moved way too fast for me. I took the entire class, but I feel that i only learned the material for the tests. I think is method of teaching does not work at all. He gives homework and then goes over it the next day. If you don't already have a backgroudn in calc like me, then it is gonna be rough.

He moves quickly and expects you to get it all. His exams require you to use what you learned to do things you haven't learned; however, he is very nice and will help you out. He never sleeps, and he is always on aim if you need help.
This guy knows his stuff. Great professor if you can keep up.

Even considering that they're curved, I actually thought the tests were easier than some of the other ones I've had!! It wasn't that hard for me, except maybe the final, and I thought he was really understanding.

Rickert's a genius, but goes through stuff very quickly, and it's hard to keep up. Tests are insanely hard to do well on, and you'll never actually finish them. Homework takes quite a while. Don't be afraid to switch teachers if he's too much for you.

This guy is the man! I learned an incredible amount in this class and greatly increased my math skills. Ricket was incredible, would definately take again. It wasn't easy, but the learning experience was the best I've ever had. (And that's saying a lot!)

Had to drop the course. Rickert is obviously extremely smart, but he moves way to fast. Homework takes several hours a night, minimum. Luckily, they're only worth 10% of your grade. Tests are long and difficult. I wouldn't take him again if you paid me.
Smart, but very difficult. Lengthy homework that sometimes requires an unmentioned "trick" to solve reasonably. Tests are monstrous.
Very hard tests, very intelligent, knows his stuff, but doesn't get it across very well at times
Feels it is his job to make students feel as stupid as possible. Not a nice person.

good teacher, really good at explaining material. Tests are extremely hard (don't plan on finishing) but he curves the tests and then does a final curve at the end of the class as well. an A was an 80% for my section)

Ditteon's lab class was fine. He demands a lot, but as long as you follow his directions, it's easy to get a good lab grade. You also learn more than you would in other labs. I bet he'd be good for class, too.

Although he is one of the top ten hardest professors here at Rose, after taking his lab course, you will be well prepared for others. He explained things well, and was very clear on what he wanted. Enjoyed listening to the Classic Rock he plays in lab.
hardest lab professor, but after you have him for lab you will always get A's on your labs.

He was a horrible teacher. He read off of hi paper to put notes on the board. He screwed up every other day. I doubt he even knew how to do half of the problems he assigned to the class for homework off the top of his head.

Definately my favorite teacher here so far. He does so many examples of problems and shows how the iterations of equations come about. Tests are difficult, but prepare you for the final exam. I learned how to think in this class.
Hardest tests ever!
